snippet: Two-thirds of women who have lumpectomies for breast cancer are receiving radiation treatment that lasts nearly twice as long as necessary, research shows.
abstract: Study published in Journal of American Medical Assn finds two-thirds of women who undergo lumpectomies for breast cancer are getting radiation treatment that lasts almost twice as long as is needed; studies show three to four weeks of radiation is just as effective as conventional treatment of five to seven weeks.
lead_paragraph: Two-thirds of women who have lumpectomies for breast cancer are receiving radiation treatment that lasts nearly twice as long as necessary, research shows.
